text: Dysoxylum gaudichaudianum is a species of plant in the family Meliaceae; its common name is ivory mahogany.Cooper, Wendy. "Fruits of the Australian tropical rainforest" (2004): 268.. "Igyo" is its native name in the Philippines. ==Taxonomy== Named for French botanist Charles Gaudichaud- Beaupré; also named D. decandrum. ==Description== Large tree of the Mahogany family, up to in height; notable for large compound leaves with conspicuous uneven bases, which tend to radiate into spherical clumps. Clusters of large pinnately compound leaves ==Distribution and habitat== Occurs in Malesia, Christmas Island, Australia from the Cape York Peninsula to the Mary River, South East Queensland, and islands of the South-West Pacific, in lowland rainforest to 300m abl. It is also found in the Philippines. ==References== ==External links== * * gaudichaudianum Category:Trees of Australia Category:Flora of Queensland
title: Dysoxylum gaudichaudianum
